So does that mean that it doesn’t matter if you overestimate the value a bit?

Also, the `PseudoclockDevice.trigger()` method is never called with a `wait_delay`.  And `Output.wait_delay` doesn't appear to be used anywhere either \(everything uses `compiler.wait_delay`\). I suspect this means the code is not actually doing what those comments imply \(which is why I'm confused\). It seems like for a secondary pseudoclock, the `wait_delay` should determine the minimum wait length \(if my understanding of what you said is correct\), but I think it's not because it isn't being passed to `trigger` when it is called [here](#!/labscript_suite/labscript/src/fa1636c366f2200c907a56b0106306b7e2ce5109/labscript.py#lines-2152).

This might actually explain why a few years ago I saw secondary PulseBlasters occasionally not be retriggered correctly after a wait.
